# DatasetDict { #atdata.DatasetDict }

```python
DatasetDict(splits=None, sample_type=None, streaming=False)
```

A dictionary of split names to Dataset instances.

Similar to HuggingFace's DatasetDict, this provides a container for
multiple dataset splits (train, test, validation, etc.) with convenience
methods that operate across all splits.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type   | Description                                    | Default    |
|--------|--------|------------------------------------------------|------------|
| ST     |        | The sample type for all datasets in this dict. | _required_ |

## Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

```python
>>> ds_dict = load_dataset("path/to/data", MyData)
>>> train = ds_dict["train"]
>>> test = ds_dict["test"]
>>>
>>> # Iterate over all splits
>>> for split_name, dataset in ds_dict.items():
...     print(f"{split_name}: {len(dataset.shard_list)} shards")
```

## Attributes

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| [num_shards](#atdata.DatasetDict.num_shards) | Number of shards in each split. |
| [sample_type](#atdata.DatasetDict.sample_type) | The sample type for datasets in this dict. |
| [streaming](#atdata.DatasetDict.streaming) | Whether this DatasetDict was loaded in streaming mode. |
